form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: APPLICATION TO CLASSIFY ALIEN ON BASIS OF PREFERENCE STATUS, FORM 1-140

full_text: Screened by NARA, 9/21/2023 TI Form approved Budget Bureau No. R418.5. TITION TO CLASSIFY DATE FILED , FEE STAMP PREFERENCE STATUS OF ALIEN ON BASIS OF by PROFESSION OR OCCUPATION 5/15/69 PHIPSI TO THE SECRETARY OF STATE The petition was filed on MAY 15, 1967 The petition is approved The petition is revalidated to for status under section 203(a) 16). Approval expires: MAY 10, 1968 Sec. 212(a)(14) certification attached. Sec. 212(a)(14) certification attached. Blanket Sec. 212(a)(14) certification issued. Blanket Sec. 212(a)(14) certification issued. REMARKS STRICT DIRECTOR DISTRICT DIRECTOR DISTRICT DATE DISTRICT DATE has LOS ANGELES CALIFORNIA 27 1967 PETITIONER IS NOT TO WRITE ABOVE THIS LINE Read this form and the attached instructions carefully before filling in petition Petition is hereby made to classify the status of the alien beneficiary named herein for issuance of an immigrant visa as ("X" one) A THIRD PREFERENCE IMMIGRANT-An alien who is a member of the professions, or who because of his exceptional ability in the sciences or arts will substantially benefit prospectively the national economy, cultural interests or welfare of the United States. (Sec. 203 (a) (3) Immigration and Nationality Act, as amended.) If this box is checked, the alien or a person on his behalf, must complete only Part I, below. A SIXTH PREFERENCE IMMIGRANT-A alien who is capable of performing skilled or unskilled labor, not of a tempo- rary or seasonal nature, for which a shortage of employable and willing persons exists in the United States. (Sec. (6), Immigration and Nationality Act, as amended.) If this block is checked, alien's prospective employer must complete Parts I and II below. (If you need more space to answer fully any questions on this form, use a separate sheet, identify each answer with the number of the corresponding question and sign and date each sheet.) PART I-INFORMATION CONCERNING ALIEN BENEFICIARY 1. NAME (Family name in capital letters) (First name) Middle name) (Maiden name, if alien is a married woman) LO Yung Sing 2. BIRTHDATE 3. BIRTHPLACE (City or town) (State or province) (Country) 4. PRESENT NATIONALITY OR CITIZENSHIP no Dec. 25, 1910 Kiukiang Kiangsi China Chinese 5. PRESENT ADDRESS (Number and street) (City or town) (State or province) (Country) (ZIP Code, if in U.S.) Flat C, 16th Floor, Hing Cheong Building, Shaukiwan Road, Hongkong B.C.C. 6. ADDRESS IN THE UNITED STATES WHERE ALIEN WILL RESIDE (Number) (Street) (City) (State) (ZIP Code) 1312 Ridgecrest Drive Beverly Hills, California 7. PROFESSION OR OCCUPATION cook - domestic servant 8. DOES BENEFICIARY INTEND TO ENGAGE IN HIS PROFESSION OR OCCUPATION IN THE UNITED STATES? YES NO. IF "NO," EXPLAIN. 9. TO YOUR KNOWLEDGE, HAS A VISA PETITION EVER BEENFILEDON BEHALFOF THIS BENEFICIARY BASEDON HIS PROFESSION OR OCCUPATION? YES NO. If "Yes," give name of each petitioner and date and place of filing. 10. HAS THIS BENEFICIARY EVER BEEN IN THE 11. ALIEN REGISTRATION NUMBER F ANY NO 7 180 743 UNITED STATES? ("X" ONE) YES Hong Kong Identify Card No. A075767 12. TO YOUR KNOWLEDGE, HAS THIS BENE- 12A. IF YOU MARKED "YES," GIVE THE DATE AND PLACE WHERE HIS DEPORTATION FICIARY EVER BEEN DEPORTED FROM THE HEARING WAS HELD. UNITED STATES? ("X" ONE) YES NO not applicable 13. NAME (Last name) (First name) (Middle name) BENEFICIARY'S SUM Yuk Ying SPOUSE COUNTRY OF BIRTH DATE OF BIRTH PRESENT ADDRESS (No. and Street) (City or town) (State or Province) (Country) China Dec. 2, 1921 same as beneficiary 14.
